awd_titl_txt: Engineering Research Equipment Grant:  Dye Laser System for the Development of Combustion Diagnostics
awd_abstract_narration: The Nd:YAG pumped dye laser system is used for the development                  and application of advanced laser diagnostics techniques for the                study of one- and two-phase flows in chemically reacting systems.               Projects include the development and use of LIF techniques for                  the measurement of species in chemically reacting boundary                      layers, the development of a particle size and number density in                flames, and VUV ionization hydrocarbons for mass spectrometric                  analysis.                                                                                                                                                       The addition of this piece of laboratory equipment will allow for               a comprehensive insight into specific chemical processes which                  control combustion performance in a variety of practical                        applications.
org_div_long_name: Division of Chemical, Bioengineering, Environmental, and Transport Systems
